001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004import java.util.List;
005
006import org.immutables.value.Value.Modifiable;
007
008import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.State.BehaviourState;
009import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.State.PolicyState;
010
011/**
012 * Context tracking for state machine operations, providing state management and
013 * branching support.
014 *
015 * <p>
016 * This interface manages the context for state transitions in the agent-based
017 * modeling framework:
018 * <ul>
019 * <li>Tracks the baseline (default) state for the state machine</li>
020 * <li>Maintains a stack of branch states for temporary state transitions</li>
021 * <li>Captures reactive testing flags that influence state behavior</li>
022 * <li>Provides operations for managing state branching and recovery</li>
023 * </ul>
024 *
025 * <h2>Branching Mechanism</h2>
026 * <p>
027 * The branching mechanism allows state machines to temporarily enter
028 * alternative states (e.g., testing states, non-compliance behaviors) and then
029 * return to the baseline. Branches are managed as a stack structure (LIFO)
030 * through {@link #pushState(State)} and corresponding pull methods.
031 *
032 * <h2>Integration with StateMachine</h2>
033 * <p>
034 * This context is primarily used by {@link StateMachine} to manage state
035 * transitions: {@link StateMachine#forceTo(BehaviourState)} and
036 * {@link StateMachine#forceTo(PolicyState)} push the current state to branches
037 * before switching, while {@link StateMachine#returnFromBranch()} retrieves
038 * states using the pull methods.
039 *
040 * <h2>Reactive Testing</h2>
041 * <p>
042 * The {@code #isReactivelyTestedToday()} flag indicates whether a reactive
043 * testing event occurred today, which may influence state transitions (e.g.,
044 * entering isolation after positive test results). The flag is reset daily
045 * through {@link #resetFlags()}.
046 *
047 * @see StateMachine
048 * @see State
049 * @see BehaviourState
050 * @see PolicyState
051 */
052@Modifiable
053public interface StateMachineContext extends Serializable {
054
055        /**
056         * Gets the baseline (default) state for the state machine. This is the state
057         * to which the machine returns after all branches are exhausted.
058         *
059         * @return the baseline state object
060         */
061        public State<?, ?, ?, ?> getBaselineState();
062
063        /**
064         * Gets the current stack of branch states. States are maintained in order
065         * from most recent to oldest.
066         *
067         * @return an ordered list of branch states (most recent first)
068         */
069        public List<State<?, ?, ?, ?>> getBranchState();
070
071        /**
072         * Checks if a reactive testing event occurred today. Reactive testing
073         * typically refers to testing triggered by symptoms or contact tracing.
074         *
075         * @return true if reactive testing occurred today, false otherwise
076         */
077        public boolean isReactivelyTestedToday();
078
079        /**
080         * Pulls and removes the most recent behavior state from the branch stack. If
081         * no branches exist, returns to the baseline state.
082         *
083         * @return the next behavior state to transition to
084         * @throws RuntimeException if the retrieved state is not a behavior state
085         */
086        public default State.BehaviourState pullBehaviour() {
087                State<?, ?, ?, ?> out;
088                if (this.getBranchState().size() > 0) {
089                        out = this.getBranchState().get(0);
090                        this.getBranchState().remove(0);
091
092                } else {
093                        out = this.getBaselineState();
094                }
095                if (out instanceof State.BehaviourState)
096                        return (State.BehaviourState) out;
097                throw new RuntimeException("Wrong type of state");
098        }
099
100        /**
101         * Pulls and removes the most recent policy state from the branch stack. If
102         * no branches exist, returns to the baseline state.
103         *
104         * @return the next policy state to transition to
105         * @throws RuntimeException if the retrieved state is not a policy state
106         */
107        public default State.PolicyState pullPolicy() {
108                State<?, ?, ?, ?> out;
109                if (this.getBranchState().size() > 0) {
110                        out = this.getBranchState().get(0);
111                        this.getBranchState().remove(0);
112
113                } else {
114                        out = this.getBaselineState();
115                }
116                if (out instanceof State.PolicyState) return (State.PolicyState) out;
117                throw new RuntimeException("Wrong type of state");
118        }
119
120        /**
121         * Pushes the current state to the branch stack. This operation is typically
122         * called before forcing a state transition to preserve the current state for
123         * later recovery.
124         *
125         * @param state the state to push onto the branch stack
126         */
127        public default void pushState(State<?, ?, ?, ?> state) {
128                this.getBranchState().add(0, state);
129        }
130
131        /**
132         * Resets daily flags including the reactive testing flag. Called at the
133         * beginning of each simulation day to clear transient state.
134         */
135        public default void resetFlags() {
136                this.setReactivelyTestedToday(false);
137        }
138
139        /**
140         * Sets the reactive testing flag to indicate testing occurred today.
141         *
142         * @param flag true if reactive testing occurred, false otherwise
143         * @return the updated context with the new flag value
144         */
145        StateMachineContext setReactivelyTestedToday(boolean flag);
146
147}
